explanation: The loop used a hard-coded range(63), which will cause an IndexError if the input list A has fewer (or more) than 63 elements. I changed that single line to iterate over the actual length of A using range(len(A)), so the loop only accesses valid indices of A.
fixed_code:
A = list(map(int,input().split()))
S = 0

import math

for i in range(len(A)):
    S = S + A[i]*(pow(2,i))
    
print(S)
